title: Sydney Hinam
text:
Sydney Hinam (29 August 1898 – 16 August 1982) was a Welsh <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> and professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1920s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales</a>, and at club level for <a href="Cardiff%20RFC">Cardiff RFC</a> and <a href="Glamorgan%20Police%20RFC">Glamorgan Police RFC</a>, as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Flanker">flanker</a>, i.e. number 6 or 7, and representative level rugby league (RL) for <a href="Glamorgan%20rugby%20league%20team">Glamorgan</a>, and at club level for <a href="Rochdale%20Hornets">Rochdale Hornets</a>, as a , i.e. number 8 or 10, during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
Background.
Sydney Hinam was born in <a href="Pontypool">Pontypool</a>, Wales, and he died aged 83 in <a href="Cardiff">Cardiff</a>, Wales.
Playing career.
International honours.
Sydney Hinam won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales</a> (RU) while at Cardiff RFC in 1925 against Ireland, and England, and in 1926 against Scotland, Ireland, and France.
County honours.
Sydney Hinam played left-, i.e. number 10, in <a href="Glamorgan%20rugby%20league%20team">Glamorgan</a>'s 18-14 victory over <a href="Monmouthshire%20rugby%20league%20team">Monmouthshire</a> in the non-<a href="County%20Championship%20%28rugby%20league%29">County Championship</a> match during the <a href="1926%E2%80%9327%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1926–27 season</a> at <a href="Taff%20Vale%20Park">Taff Vale Park</a>, <a href="Pontypridd">Pontypridd</a> on Saturday 30 April 1927.
